title: Ewan MacNaughton, affable ‘Telegraph’ journalist who as syndication manager spread the paper’s articles and pictures across the world – obituary
text:
Ewan MacNaughton, who has died aged 87, was an old-school newsman who extended the global reach of Telegraph journalism in the age before the internet.

Telegraph scoops, and dispatches from its network of foreign correspondents, were sold to papers in the US, Europe and Japan and across the Commonwealth in his 30 years as the paper’s syndication manager. In the new era of colour printing, lavish Telegraph picture spreads brightened magazines across the world.

His affability, wide contacts and a capacity for mixing business with pleasure boosted sales. MacNaughton arrived in the office well-briefed on national and office politics, as his travelling companion up from Kent was Bill Deedes, the editor...
